Independent Auditor's Report & Financial Statements Template ‚Äã

This template provides a standard format for an Independent Auditor's Report and the accompanying Financial Statements, compliant with Nepal Standards on Auditing (NSA), Nepal Accounting Standards (NAS), and relevant regulatory requirements.

It is designed for Chartered Accountants and Registered Auditors to streamline their reporting process for standard corporate entities.

Usage

Copy the content below into your document editor (Word/Google Docs) and replace the bracketed placeholders [ ... ] with your specific client details.

1. Independent Auditor's Report ‚Äã

markdown
**INDEPENDENT AUDITOR'S REPORT**

To the Shareholders / Board of Directors of [Company Name]
[Address of the Company]

**Report on the Audit of the Financial Statements**

**Opinion**
We have audited the accompanying financial statements of [Company Name] (the "Company"), which comprise the Statement of Financial Position as at [Date] (e.g., Ashad 31, 2080), the Statement of Profit or Loss (Income Statement), Statement of Cash Flows, and Statement of Changes in Equity for the year then ended, and a summary of significant accounting policies and other explanatory notes.

In our opinion, the accompanying financial statements give a true and fair view of the financial position of the Company as at [Date], and of its financial performance and its cash flows for the year then ended in accordance with Nepal Financial Reporting Standards (NFRS) / Nepal Accounting Standards (NAS) and comply with the Companies Act, 2063 and prevailing laws.

**Basis for Opinion**
We conducted our audit in accordance with Nepal Standards on Auditing (NSAs). Our responsibilities under those standards are further described in the *Auditor's Responsibilities for the Audit of the Financial Statements* section of our report. We are independent of the Company in accordance with the Handbook of The Code of Ethics for Professional Accountants issued by The Institute of Chartered Accountants of Nepal (ICAN), and we have fulfilled our other ethical responsibilities in accordance with these requirements.

We believe that the audit evidence we have obtained is sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our opinion.

**Key Audit Matters**
Key audit matters are those matters that, in our professional judgment, were of most significance in our audit of the financial statements of the current period. These matters were addressed in the context of our audit of the financial statements as a whole, and in forming our opinion thereon, and we do not provide a separate opinion on these matters.

| **Key Audit Matter** | **How our Audit addressed the Key Audit Matter** |
| :--- | :--- |
| **[Matter 1 Title]** <br> *Description of the matter, why it is significant, and reference to related notes.* | *Description of audit procedures performed to address the matter.* |
| **[Matter 2 Title]** <br> *Description...* | *Description...* |

*[Note: If there are no Key Audit Matters to communicate, this section may be omitted or stated as "We have determined that there are no key audit matters to communicate in our report."]*

**Responsibilities of Management and Those Charged with Governance for the Financial Statements**
Management is responsible for the preparation and fair presentation of the financial statements in accordance with NAS/NFRS, and for such internal control as management determines is necessary to enable the preparation of financial statements that are free from material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error.

In preparing the financial statements, management is responsible for assessing the Company‚Äôs ability to continue as a going concern, disclosing, as applicable, matters related to going concern and using the going concern basis of accounting unless management either intends to liquidate the Company or to cease operations, or has no realistic alternative but to do so.

Those charged with governance are responsible for overseeing the Company‚Äôs financial reporting process.

**Auditor's Responsibilities for the Audit of the Financial Statements**
Our objectives are to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements as a whole are free from material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error, and to issue an auditor‚Äôs report that includes our opinion. Reasonable assurance is a high level of assurance, but is not a guarantee that an audit conducted in accordance with NSAs will always detect a material misstatement when it exists.

Misstatements can arise from fraud or error and are considered material if, individually or in the aggregate, they could reasonably be expected to influence the economic decisions of users taken on the basis of these financial statements.

**Report on Other Legal and Regulatory Requirements**
We have audited the attached financial statements accordingly and report that:
1. We have obtained prompt replies to our queries including satisfactory explanation during the course of the audit.
2. In our opinion, proper books of accounts have been maintained by the Company.
3. The Financial Statements dealt with by this report are in agreement with the books of accounts maintained by the Company.
4. We have not come across any fraudulence in the accounts on our sample examination of the books of accounts of the current year.
5. We have issued a separate management letter comprising of our observations and recommendations.
6. [Other specific reporting requirements, e.g., under BAFIA, Insurance Act, etc.]

For: [Name of Audit Firm]
Chartered Accountants

____________________
[Name of Partner/Proprietor]
[Designation (e.g., Managing Partner)]
Date: [Date of Report]
Place: [Place of Signing]
UDIN: [UDIN Number]

2. Financial Statements Templates ‚Äã

Statement of Financial Position (Balance Sheet) ‚Äã

markdown
**[COMPANY NAME]**
**Statement of Financial Position**
**As at [Date] (e.g., Ashad 31, 20XX)**

| **Particulars** | **Note** | **Current Year (NRs.)** | **Previous Year (NRs.)** |
| :--- | :---: | :---: | :---: |
| **ASSETS** | | | |
| **Non-Current Assets** | | | |
| Property, Plant and Equipment | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Intangible Assets | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Investments | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Deferred Tax Assets | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Other Non-Current Assets | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| **Total Non-Current Assets** | | **[Total]** | **[Total]** |
| | | | |
| **Current Assets** | | | |
| Inventories | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Trade and Other Receivables | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Cash and Cash Equivalents | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Current Tax Assets (Net) | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Other Current Assets | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| **Total Current Assets** | | **[Total]** | **[Total]** |
| **TOTAL ASSETS** | | **[Start Total]** | **[End Total]** |
| | | | |
| **EQUITY AND LIABILITIES** | | | |
| **Equity** | | | |
| Share Capital | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Reserves & Surplus | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| **Total Equity Attributable to Owners** | | **[Total]** | **[Total]** |
| Non-Controlling Interest | | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| **Total Equity** | | **[Total]** | **[Total]** |
| | | | |
| **Non-Current Liabilities** | | | |
| Long Term Borrowings | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Deferred Tax Liabilities | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Retirement Benefit Obligations | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| **Total Non-Current Liabilities** | | **[Total]** | **[Total]** |
| | | | |
| **Current Liabilities** | | | |
| Trade and Other Payables | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Short Term Borrowings | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Current Tax Liabilities (Net) | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Provisions | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| **Total Current Liabilities** | | **[Total]** | **[Total]** |
| **TOTAL EQUITY AND LIABILITIES** | | **[Start Total]** | **[End Total]** |

Statement of Profit or Loss (Income Statement) ‚Äã

markdown
**[COMPANY NAME]**
**Statement of Profit or Loss and Other Comprehensive Income**
**For the Year Ended [Date] (e.g., Ashad 31, 20XX)**

| **Particulars** | **Note** | **Current Year (NRs.)** | **Previous Year (NRs.)** |
| :--- | :---: | :---: | :---: |
| **INCOME** | | | |
| Revenue from Operations | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Other Income | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| **Total Income (A)** | | **[Total]** | **[Total]** |
| | | | |
| **EXPENSES** | | | |
| Cost of Sales | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Employee Benefits Expenses | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Administrative Expenses | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Selling & Distribution Expenses | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Depreciation & Amortization | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Finance Costs | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| **Total Expenses (B)** | | **[Total]** | **[Total]** |
| | | | |
| **Profit Before Tax (A - B)** | | **[Profit]** | **[Profit]** |
| Less: Tax Expense | | | |
| - Current Tax | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| - Deferred Tax | [Note X] | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| **Net Profit for the Year** | | **[Net Profit]** | **[Net Profit]** |
| | | | |
| **Other Comprehensive Income (OCI)** | | | |
| Items that will be reclassified to profit or loss | | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| Items that will not be reclassified to profit or loss | | [Amount] | [Amount] |
| **Total Comprehensive Income** | | **[Total]** | **[Total]** |

Statement of Changes in Equity ‚Äã

markdown
**[COMPANY NAME]**
**Statement of Changes in Equity**
**For the Year Ended [Date] (e.g., Ashad 31, 20XX)**

| **Particulars** | **Share Capital** | **Share Premium** | **Retained Earnings** | **General Reserve** | **Total Equity** |
| :--- | :---: | :---: | :---: | :---: | :---: |
| **Balance at [Start Date]** | **[Amt]** | **[Amt]** | **[Amt]** | **[Amt]** | **[Total]** |
| Profit for the Year | - | - | [Amount] | - | [Amount] |
| Other Comprehensive Income | - | - | [Amount] | - | [Amount] |
| Dividends Paid | - | - | ([Amount]) | - | ([Amount]) |
| Issue of Share Capital | [Amount] | [Amount] | - | - | [Total] |
| Transfer to Reserves | - | - | ([Amount]) | [Amount] | - |
| **Balance at [End Date]** | **[Amt]** | **[Amt]** | **[Amt]** | **[Amt]** | **[Total]** |

Statement of Cash Flows ‚Äã

markdown
**[COMPANY NAME]**
**Statement of Cash Flows**
**For the Year Ended [Date] (e.g., Ashad 31, 20XX)**

| **Particulars** | **Amount (NRs.)** |
| :--- | :---: |
| **A. CASH FLOW FROM OPERATING ACTIVITIES** | |
| Net Profit Before Tax | [Amount] |
| *Adjustments for non-cash items:* | |
| Depreciation & Amortization | [Amount] |
| Finance Costs | [Amount] |
| Interest Income | ([Amount]) |
| (Gain)/Loss on Sale of Assets | [Amount] |
| **Operating Profit Before Working Capital Changes** | **[Subtotal]** |
| *Working Capital Adjustments:* | |
| (Increase)/Decrease in Inventories | [Amount] |
| (Increase)/Decrease in Trade & Other Receivables | [Amount] |
| Increase/(Decrease) in Trade & Other Payables | [Amount] |
| Increase/(Decrease) in Provisions | [Amount] |
| **Cash Generated from Operations** | **[Subtotal]** |
| Income Tax Paid | ([Amount]) |
| **Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities (A)** | **[Total A]** |
| | |
| **B. CASH FLOW FROM INVESTING ACTIVITIES** | |
| Purchase of Property, Plant & Equipment | ([Amount]) |
| Proceeds from Sale of Property, Plant & Equipment | [Amount] |
| Purchase of Investments | ([Amount]) |
| Interest Received | [Amount] |
| Dividend Received | [Amount] |
| **Net Cash Flow from Investing Activities (B)** | **[Total B]** |
| | |
| **C. CASH FLOW FROM FINANCING ACTIVITIES** | |
| Proceeds from Issue of Share Capital | [Amount] |
| Proceeds from Long Term Borrowings | [Amount] |
| Repayment of Long Term Borrowings | ([Amount]) |
| Payment of Dividends | ([Amount]) |
| Interest Paid | ([Amount]) |
| **Net Cash Flow from Financing Activities (C)** | **[Total C]** |
| | |
| **Net Increase/(Decrease) in Cash (A+B+C)** | **[Net Change]** |
| Cash & Cash Equivalents at Beginning of Year | [Opening Bal] |
| **Cash & Cash Equivalents at End of Year** | **[Closing Bal]** |

3. Significant Accounting Policies & Notes ‚Äã

markdown
**[COMPANY NAME]**
**Significant Accounting Policies & Notes to Accounts**
**For the Year Ended [Date]**

**1. Corporate Information**
[Company Name] is a [Type of Entity] incorporated under the Companies Act of Nepal. The registered office is located at [Address]. The principal activities of the Company include [Activities].

**2. Basis of Preparation**
*   **Statement of Compliance:** The financial statements have been prepared in accordance with Nepal Financial Reporting Standards (NFRS) / Nepal Accounting Standards (NAS).
*   **Basis of Measurement:** The financial statements have been prepared on historical cost basis, except for certain financial instruments which are measured at fair value.
*   **Functional and Presentation Currency:** The financial statements are presented in Nepalese Rupees (NPR), which is the Company's functional currency.
*   **Use of Estimates:** The preparation of financial statements requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities.

**3. Significant Accounting Policies**
*   **Property, Plant and Equipment:** Recognized at cost less accumulated depreciation and impairment losses. Depreciation is charged on [Basis, e.g., Straight Line] method over the estimated useful lives.
*   **Intangible Assets:** Recognized at cost less accumulated amortization.
*   **Financial Instruments:**
    *   *Financial Assets:* Classified as amortized cost, fair value through profit or loss (FVTPL), or fair value through other comprehensive income (FVOCI).
    *   *Financial Liabilities:* Classified as amortized cost or FVTPL.
*   **Inventories:** Valued at the lower of cost or net realizable value. Cost is determined using [Method, e.g., Weighted Average].
*   **Revenue Recognition:** Revenue is recognized when control of the goods or services transfers to the customer.
*   **Income Tax:** Current tax is measured at the amount expected to be paid to the tax authorities. Deferred tax is recognized on temporary differences.

**4. Notes to Accounts**
(Provide detailed schedules for specific line items in the Financial Statements, e.g., PPE Schedule, Share Capital details, Contingent Liabilities, Related Party Transactions, etc.)
